Class Projects

java.lang.Object
Projects
public class Projects extends Object
This is the projects class which reads, writes, updates and deletes data about projects and people in the database.

The program forms part of the project management system for a small structural engineering firm called “Poised”, and uses Java and MySQL to connect to the database 'PoisePMS'.

Version:
JDK 18.0.1.1
Author:
Nichole Dobbin

  • Constructor Details

    • Projects

      public Projects(String projectName, String buildingType, String projectAddress, int erfNumber, Double totalProjectFee, Double totalPaid, Date projectDeadline, int architectID, int contractorID, int managerID, int customerID, String projectFinalized)
      Constructor method for projects instances
      Parameters:
      projectName - the project's name
      buildingType - the project's building type
      projectAddress - the project's address
      erfNumber - the project's erf number
      totalProjectFee - the project's total fee
      totalPaid - the total amount paid by the project's customer
      projectDeadline - the date by which the project must be completed
      architectID - the id of the architect assigned to the project
      contractorID - the id of the contractor assigned to the project
      managerID - the id of the project manager assigned to the project
      customerID - the id of the customer assigned to the project
      projectFinalized - the string identifying project finalization

  • Method Details

    • assignProjectName

      public static void assignProjectName()
      This method assigns a project name as [(Building Type) (Customer Surname)] when the name is unknown

      This method finds projects in the database without a project name value and assigns the project name as that project's building type and customer surname, e.g., 'House Tyson', and it is called in the addNewProject() method to ensure all inputted projects have a name.

    • addNewProject

      public static void addNewProject()
      This method retrieves all the information required to create and add a new project to the database.

      This method retrieves user input for project details and calls the methods listed in the See Also section. It creates a new project instance with retrieved input and adds the new project to the database, and calls the assignProjectName() method to assign a project name and the PrintProjects.getAllProjectsFull() method to print the updated projects list.

      See Also:
      • Architects.chooseArchitect()
      • Contractors.chooseContractor()
      • Managers.chooseManager()
      • Customers.chooseCustomer()
      • Customers.addCustomer()

    • updateProject

      public static void updateProject()
      This method allows the user to update fields in any of the existing projects.

      Update options do not include updating the project number (because it is the primary key and needs to be unique) or updating the completion date (because that is updated when the project is finalized). The method prints a concise list of all projects in the 'projects' table, gets the user selection of the project and field they want to update, and updates the selected fields in the database. It uses the methods listed in the See Also section below to print project lists and update the architect, contractor, project manager and customer fields and recursively calls itself if invalid actions are entered.

      See Also:
      • PrintProjects.getAllProjectsConcise()
      • PrintProjects.getCurrentProjectConcise(int inputtedProjectNumber)
      • PrintProjects.getCurrentProjectFull(int inputtedProjectNumber)
      • Architects.chooseArchitect()
      • Contractors.chooseContractor()
      • Managers.chooseManager()
      • Customers.chooseCustomer()
      • Customers.addCustomer()

    • deleteProject

      public static void deleteProject()
      This method deletes a project and its associated people if all people assigned to the project are not assigned to any other projects. If it's people are assigned elsewhere, only the project's data is deleted.

      If an architect, contractor, customer or project manager assigned to the project is also assigned to other projects, only the project's data will be deleted from the 'projects' table and its assigned people's data will not be deleted from the other tables or projects in the database. The method prints the updated projects lists by calling the PrintProjects.getAllProjectsConcise() method.

    • finalizeProject

      public static void finalizeProject()
      This method finalizes a project.

      This method finds and prints all projects with the value 'not finalized' in the proj_finalized field, and gets user selection for the project number they want finalized. It then updates the database's proj_finalized field to 'finalized' and sets the date_completed filed to the current date, and prints the updated list of all projects by calling the PrintProjects.getAllProjectsFull() method.

    • getIncompleteProjects

      public static void getIncompleteProjects()
      This method finds and prints all incomplete projects.

      It finds and prints all projects with the value NULL in the date_completed field (i.e. projects which do not have a completion date).

    • getOverdueProjects

      public static void getOverdueProjects()
      This method finds and prints all overdue projects.

      It finds and prints all projects where the proj_deadline field values are less than the current date (i.e. projects whose deadline has already passed).

    • getProjectByNameOrNumber

      public static void getProjectByNameOrNumber()
      This method finds a project by getting either the project name or the project number from the user, and prints the project's full details.

      If the user chooses to find a project by project number, only one project will be found because the project number is a unique primary key. If the user choose to find a project by name, multiple projects could be found because the project name is not unique. It prints the found projects by calling the method PrintProjects.getCurrentProjectFull(int inputtedProjectNumber).
